text.p: The following are top stories from selected Singapore newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- People's Action Party scores resounding victory in general election on nationwide swing of voters to party, sweeping 34 of 36 seats contested.
- Singapore Prime Minister Goh Chok Tong says People's Action Party's victory in Cheng San GRC shows voters rejection of racial politics.
- Malaysia Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad announces unlisted Maju Holdings has 51 percent stake in privatisation of Perwaja Steel.
- Sapura Holdings is eyeing stake in UMW Holdings.
- Total membership of Malaysian-listed companies with market capitalisation of at least Malaysian $1 billion rose to record 166 at end of last year.
- People's Action Party takes 81 seats, loses two in General Elections.
- Investors in stock market expect to focus on events in overseas markets, particularly Wall Street, more than on local general election results.
